Given only one applicant in the inbox this round and the risk of ending unmatched if we wait, it is strategically better to accept Parent_D now rather than reject and hope for higher-priority candidates who have weaker interest in Nursery_C.

Parent_B previously applied and was rejected; they are #3 for us, so accepting Parent_A is better than holding out for Parent_D unless Parent_D is likely to apply soon. Looking at Parent_D’s preferences (Nursery_C first, then A, then B), they will likely apply to C and/or A before us; and nurseries C and A rank Parent_D highly enough that Parent_D has a strong chance to be taken before reaching Nursery_B. Therefore, accepting Parent_A now secures a high-priority match and avoids the risk of ending up with a lower-ranked parent later or remaining unmatched.
